column1: short of good length, finds slight movement and Shahzad frees his arms to steer it to point
sprayed well down the leg side and misses the attempted glance of the batsman
and this time he overcompensates with the line and fires it too wide outside off. Shahzad stays in the crease and slashes hard without feet and gets beaten
a hat-trick of wides in the first over. Tries to get some inswing and the ball narrowly misses brushing the thigh guard as Shahzad is looking to tuck it away and goes to the keeper
that's a much better line. Just outside off and on a fullish length, Shahzad shuffles across and lifts his bat to let it go
swings wildly without using his feet and promptly gets beaten outside off
and he loses control of his line again. Sprays it well down the leg side
back of a length on the stumps. Shahzad jumps up and tries to tuck it away but that perhaps just stopped on him a little. Gets a leading edge. He played very softly so it does not carry to the bowler
short of a length, jumps up and pushes it in front of covers before taking off for a single
full and on the pads, clipped away to midwicket off the pads
back of a length, straightens after it is angled in on off and middle and it is bunted back down the pitch as Shahzad gets up to ride the bounce
width on offer outside off, opens up the arms and slaps this one hard through the point region where the fielder dives but cannot put his hands to it
short of good length ball, stays in the crease and pats it into the off side without any feet
back of a length ball, swivels around and pulls it along the ground through square leg
good line and length. Tempts him with a fuller ball that straightens outside off and the batsman shoulders arms
short of good length ball, outside off, hangs back and runs it down to third man with an open bat facr
full and wide, holding its line outside off, slashes at it without any feet and gets beaten
fullish length ball, tucked straight to short midwicket
back of a length outside off, lazily tries to open the face of his bat but the ball goes not bounce as much as he expects it to and he misses it

that's a sharp catch at covers. On a length and wide, holding its line outside off and Noor Ali Zadran punches hard away from the body. Does not get to the pitch of it and fails to keep it along the ground. George Dockrell dives forward with the ball dipping on him to snaffle it
back of a length and angling down the leg side, tries to tuck it and misses. Another wide for Chase
short of a length and getting up on the batsman on leg, tucked uppishly off the hips to deep fine leg
back of a length on off, stays in the crease and defends it off the outer part of the bat to point. Stops on him a bit so it messes up his timing
full and on leg, the bat face opens in his hand as he pushes it out towards mid-off
angling in and straightening around off, comes forward and defends it to mid-off
full and outside off, comes forward and pushes it to extra cover
good length, angling in and straightening, defended
fullish and angling in, comes forward and tries to push it to the off side but the ball holds its line and goes off the inside part of the bat to the leg side
tucked off the pads behind square on the leg side
short of a length, sitting up nicely and he rocks back and pulls through midwicket
sprays it full but again loses is line, too full and wide outside off, that is his sixth wide already
full and angling in on the pads, clipped away to mid-on
short and wide, tries to pull but he has to fetch that from way outside off, ends up skewing it off the toe end down the pitch

gets some mild movement and Shahzad has edged to wide slip. On a length and angling in, gets it to shape away just enough to take the outside edge as Shahzad plays the angle. Not much feet too and Wilson takes it smartly. Big, big wicket for Ireland
pushes forward and defends it into the off side. No run there

wide outside off and flirts with the line. Umpire reckons it is okay this time but that is touch and go. Short of a length and the batsman makes no contact as he stays in the crease and slashes at it without feet
fullish outside off, comes forward and defends
full and outside off, comes forward and pushes it out into the off side
full and outside off, holding its line, presses forward, transfers the weight to the front foot in fluid fashion and crunches a drive through covers
comes forward and opens the face of his bat on the push to guide it out to third man
full and outside off, blocks from the crease
back of a length outside off, stands tall in the crease and bunts it into the off side
back of a length and outside off, hangs back and opens the face of his bat to steer it past backward point where the fielder does not put in the best of efforts

chance of a run out, missed. The throw is fired at the right end and Chase fails to collect the ball cleanly. Short and wide, slaps it to square third man where there is a fielder gyuarding the fence. They come back for the second and take on the fielder. Shah is a bit reluctant and hesitates. Direct hit or the bowler picking it up cleanly could have seen the back of him
short of good length ball, punched off the backfoot into the off side
short ball, sitting up nicely and he pulls it from outside off, beats mid-on running to his left, right through the gap between mid-on and midwicket
on the pads, overcompensates with a fuller ball that is clipped out to deep backward square leg
short ball, angling down leg, misses the pull and the ball goes down the leg side. Yet another wide. Seven wides in seven overs
short and wide, chops the slap to covers. Not enough room to play that shot
good length ball outside off, waits for it before opening the face of his bat and stabbing it to point
angling in and straightening on middle, blocked back to the bowler
full and angling in, straightening a tad late and takes the outside part of the bat as he pushes forward and goes past point
angling in and comes on with that angle on a fullish length, squirts it off the inside edge to midwicket
fullish length ball, knocks it to point from the crease
short ball, there is not enough pace on this surface to unsettle the batsman with such balls. Pulled powerfully through midwicket
on a length and holding its line outside off, left alone
on a length and outside off, stays in the crease and stabs it to point
short of good length, getting up on the batsman, jumps up and keeps it out on the off side
angling in and strikes him on the pad. Drifting in and they go up in appeal. It is an optimistic appeal more than anything as that was clearly heading down leg
full and wide outside off, add one more to the wide tally. Chase is admonishing himself
short of good length and angling in, tucked off the hips but it goes straight to the fielder at fine leg who is inside the circle
good length ball on off, defended from the crease towards mid-off
fuller and angling in on off and middle, pushed off the front foot to mid-off
on a length and blocked from the crease towards the extra cover region
fuller and on off, driven off the front foot to short cover who makes a diving save

gone through him. Plays all across the line does Rahmat Shah and he has paid the price. On a length and coming on straight. Shah tries to jump up and flick it away but the ball keeps a tad low and splinters middle stump. Need a replacement stick
fired down the leg side and it is tucked off the pads to the deep fine leg boundary

played on. Driving away from the body and it has been dragged back into the stumps. It was a very full ball and well outside off. Brings the bottom hand into play and is early into the shot as he goes for an all expansive drive
on a length and fired into middle and leg, defended back to the bowler
worked away to square leg
pitches it up outside off and the batsman comes forward and pushes it along the ground to long-off
fullish ball, pushed off the front foot to midwicket
short of good length, defended to covers
fuller and outside off, presses forward and pushes it back to the bowler
back of a length, tries to tuck it away but there is really no pace from the bowler. Also gets up at an awkward height and he makes no contact
full and shaping away outside off, the batsman is equal to the task and lets it go
full and angling in on leg, pushed down to mid-off
full and outside off, driven down to mid-off and that is a maiden from Murtagh
turned away through square leg for one
coming in with the arm and takes the inside part of the bat as he pushes forward and drives it back to the bowler
eased down to long-off off the front foot
stays in the crease and punches into the off side
width on offer outside off, opens up the arms and crunches it to the sweeper cover boundary. It goes to the left of the deep extra cover fielder
stays on the backfoot to this length ball and pushes it uppishly to long-off
worked away to square leg
full and on off, defended off the front foot to mid-off
fullish and on off, angling in, pushed to mid-off off the front foot
full and angling in, comes forward too early and squirts it off the inside edge to the left of the keeper
walks across the stumps and squeezes out this fuller ball to point
defended off the front foot down the pitch
flighted on middle and leg, sliding in with the arm, pushed to the bowler off the front foot
slower through the air and he waits for it before opening the face of his bat to steer to point
comes forward to this fullish ball and drives it out to sweeper cover
on the pads, turned away through square leg
looped up outside off, driven hardbut cannot beat the short extra cover fielder
short of good length outside off, hangs back in the crease and opens the face of his bat to run it down to the square third man region
fullish, comes forward and picks the gap in the covers region to push it out to swepeer cover
fullish, pushed to sweeper cover for one
length ball, straightening late outside off, opens the bat face and steers it through the point region
full and outside off, driven to covers
full and wide, seems like it was on the line but the umpire seems to think it is outside, that part of the crease belongs to him and he calls it a wide as the batsman leaves it alone
tucked away off the pads to deep square leg
pitched up and outside off, driven square of the wicket for one
some turn away from him outside off, waits for it before caressing  it through the cover-point region
pitched up around off, pushed back to the bowler
short of a length, punched off the backfoot to covers
too short and spinning away making it too wide as well, slaps it off the toe end of the bat to deep point
on a length and sliding in on leg, defended of the front foot back to the bowler

unfortunate run out at the non-striker's end. It was very full and Shenwari hammers it back to the bowler. He has hit  it too straight and the ball crashes bang into the stumps at the non-striker's end. The ball went off the bowler's had and the non-striker was backing up
full and wide, driven hard square of the wicket past the diving point fielder. But Peter Chase at the deep makes a good stop diving to his left. Stops it just in front of the boundary
full and outside off, driven to sweeper cover off the front foot
full and wide outside off, holding its line, left alone
sprayed down the leg side and misses the attempted late glance. Tenth wide of the innings
full on off, pushed out to covers quietly off the front foot
full and angling in, clipped away to midwicket where Stirling dives to make a stop
pitched up outside off, defended off the front foot
sliding in slightly on off before spinning away, knocks it square of the wicket
flighted outside off, comes forward and pushes it out to extra cover
pitched up on off, comes forward and defends into the off side
full and wide outside off, pushed out to short cover
on a length and turned away into the leg side
full and outside off, comes forward and gets an outside edge to third man

pitched up and sliding in on the pads, clipped away to the right of mid-on who runs across and slides but ends up parrying it away. He recovers and gives it a chase but the ball beats him to the boundary
good length ball, knocked back to the bowler
uses his wrists to flick it through square leg. Deep backward square leg runs across and picks it up with one hand
fullish length, holding its line outside off, left alone
tossed up ball, turned away into the leg side
bowled slower through the air and he is drawn forward before he pushes it into the off side
slider from Dockrell, finds the outside edge of Shenwari as the ball goes into the leg side
on a length, fired quicker and pushes the batsman back before he punches it back to the bowler
fullish on off, comes forward and pushes it back to the bowler
sliding in on leg, drilled down to long-on
fired down the leg side and left alone
back of a length stays back and pushes it back to the bowler
good length, fired quicker and spinning in, rushes him and he hurriedly knocks it back to the bowler
on the pads and clipped away into the leg side, to the midwicket region
defended off the front foot back to the bowler
stays back to this short of a length ball and whips it into the on side
worked away to midwicket. Man there and there is no run
short of a length outside off, carves it between cover and point for one
short of good length outside off, taps it with a flat bat to sweeper cover
full and outside off, drilled out hard to mid-off
short of good length and outside off, steers it wide of point, plays late to pick the gap
full and on middle and leg, pushed to mid-off
fired on the pads and kisses it as he fails to clip it away and the ball goes away to fine leg
sprayed down the leg side and the batsman misses the tuck. Another wide
flat and on a length, plays the angle and the ball spins in to take the inside edge
flat, short of good length, spinning in slightly, punched down to long-on
flat and fuller this time, nudged away to the midwicket region
presses forward and defends this fuller ball back down the pitch
pushed off the front foot to the right of the bowler for one
drilled hard back to the bowler and he tumbles over after it hits him on the right shin
back of a length, jumps up and bunts it down the pitch
short of good length outside off, kept out from the backfoot towards mid-off
tries to slap this wider ball but it bounces too much and comfortably beats the bat
short and wide, this time it sits up nicely and Naib lays into a cut shot as the ball screams into the deep point boundary
short of good length ball, the batsman is pushed back and keeps it out
width on offer again and he slaps it again but this time it is not as square, flays it between cover and point and sweeper cover gets around it easily
back of a length, punched to the right of the bowler who dives across and fields it
flat and short of a length, knocked to mid-on from the crease and the fielder dives to make the stop
punched off the backfoot to long-on
flat and full outside off, comes forward and plays for the turn but it is too full to do anything after pitching and he gets an outside edge to short third man
tries to clip it away and it goes off the pad into the leg side. Would have missed leg
shuffles across and uses the depth of the crease to block this short of a length ball

gets down for a slog sweep and he has picked out deep backward square leg. The change of ends works for McBrine immediately. Has to fetch it from outside off and not much turn also. Probably gets it finer than he would have liked and the ball goes to Murtagh who dives forward to snaffle it
comes forward and defends off the inside part of the bat
pushed off the front foot to the left of the bowler and he runs across on the follow-through to pick it up
comes forward and defends off the front foot as the ball goes back to the bowler
pushed back to the bowler off the inside part of the bat

pitched up outside off, driven off the front foot to cover. Just wide of the fielder and he dives to get his hands to it. Parries it away slightly but gets up and recovers quickly. Rashid wants the single but the non-striker is not interested. Has to rush back and makes it safely in the end
short of a length, punched down to long-on for one
full and outside off, comes forward and defends and the ball goes off the outside edge into the off side as it comes on with the bowler's arms
short and wide, slapped away to sweeper cover
pitched up on off, clipped off the front foot to midwicket
fuller ball, gets a top edge on the sweep but the ball goes away to square leg, over the man at short square
tucked off the backfoot past the diving midwicket fielder
on the pads, turned away to square leg for one
pitched up on leg, nudged towards the mid-on region and the bowler runs across and picks it up
short of a length and spinning in, punched to long-on
plays for the turn and gets it off the outside part of the bat as the ball goes to the off side
fullish, driven crisply off the front foot to short cover
drifting on leg, gets down to sweep and short fine leg dives to his right to keep it to one
pitched up outside off, driven to covers
what happened there. Turning away outside off, it's the legbreak and Rashid tries to pull, ball does not bounce as much and he goes down on the back knee and misses
full toss, comes on at a bit of an awkward height but he manages to dispatch it over the deep midwicket boundary
seems like another full toss and it dips and ends up being a yorker, dug out
short and wide, slapped to deep point for one
spinning away, giving him some width outside off again and it is cut out to sweeper cover
back of a length, spinning in, makes room and whips it away to long-off
knocked back to the right of the bowler who dives and stops it
turned away off the pads to the midwicket region
on the pads, clipped away through square leg for one
fuller outside off, comes forward and drills it to midwicket
on a length and spinning in, stays back and drills it down to long-on
plays for the turn and the ball comes on straight with the arm. Full and on the stumps, tries to force it through the off side and gets an inside edge to fine leg
front foot defence to the left of the bowler
short and wide, slapped away to sweeper cover
flat, on a length, punched to mid-off where Porterfield dives to his right full-length
fuller this time, pushed out to mid-off off the front foot
shorter in length, backs away to give himself some room and cuts it to sweeper cover
fullish and on leg, hangs back and gets an outside edge to the gully region
fuller, swept away to deep midwicket
short of good length, punched to midwicket
defended down the pitch

pitched up on off, picks the length up early, backs away to give himself the room to open up and launches it staight down the ground. Didn't hit ti too hard and dispatches it with a straight bat over long-off
fuller, drilled straight back to the bowler
sliding on leg, kept out to the leg side

hangs back and drops it in the gap at covers before taking off for a quick single. There is a throw fired at the bowler's end. Direct hit, but batsman has made it back and it deflects away allowing for the extra run
short and wide, cut square of the wicket to backward point
pitched up on middle and leg, driven out to long-off
on a length and on the stumps, blocked into the off side
defended back to the bowler
on the pads, tucked to fine leg
pitched up on middle and leg, defended off the front foot
spins in more than he expects and the ball goes off the inside part of the bat through midwicket
on a length, comes forward and defends into the off side
advances down the ground. This is generously flighted and he meets the pitch of it before launching it over long-off
nudged to midwicket. No run there
short of a length, sticks the bat out without moving his feet and defends into the off side
back of a length, punched to short cover
short and wide, tries to cut but has to reach out for it a long way and misses. Too wide
full and on the pads, asking to be put away. Naib obliges and the ball goes between deep square leg and fine leg
full and straight, dabbed back to the bowler off the front foot
on a length, some width on offer, carves it out to sweeper cover off the backfoot
sprayed down the leg side and called a wide, just misses the thigh guard of the batsman
full and coming on straight, defended back to the bowler
on a length, not much turn, knocks it to midwicket from the crease
this time it is pitched up and the batsman is solidly forward as he defends
tucked away to midwicket off the pads for a quick single
fuller ball, pushed off the front foot to long-off
worked to covers
pitched up outside off, drilled down to long-off
short ball, swivels around and pulls to deep fine leg
full and outside off, stays in the crease and defends it towards mid-off
on a length, outside off, opens the bat face and drills it out to sweeper cover as he finds the gap on the in-field

great keeping by Niall O'Brien. Prevents what could have been a lucky boundary. Full and wide outside off, reaches out for it without feet and tries to launch it over the in-field on the off side. Gets an inside edge that should have gone to fine leg but for the keeper diving behind the stumps in a flash and stopping it
short of a length, down the leg side and the batsman misses it as he looks to turn it away around the corner
down the ground, drilled hard to mid-on. Had to fetch it from outside off
gets across to sweep but the ball slides in on leg, he just manages to get his bat or a glove to it. Had he missed, he would have been bowled around the legs
back of a length, punched down to long-on

short and sliding down leg. Not so much room given the angle but he manages to swivel around and nail a pull shot bang off the middle of the bat as the ball goes over the boundary wide of the deep midwicket region
comes forward and the ball is sliding in and takes the inside part of the bat as it goes to mid-on
comes down the track and takes it on the full, it's a full toss and it is whipped away quite stylishly to deep midwicket
defended down the pitch
full and just outside off, clipped hard to mid-on
short of a length, not quite short enough for the pull shot but luckily for Rashid he has got it just over the midwicket fielder who jumps up with outstretched hands
drifting in on the pads at a fullish length, clips it off the toes and bisects the field, between deep square leg and deep fine leg
short of a length and angling in, gets an inside edge to midwicket
short and wide and cut hard off the backfoot. Plays it uppishly but also plays it late to place it wide of the point fielder. Half-century for Rashid, what a knock this has been from him
defended to covers
short, wide, slapped uppishly over the in-field on the off side, through the covers region. Can't be bowling there to a set batsman
not as short this time but lots of width on offer again, flays it square of the wicket and the ball is fielded in front of the boundary
short ball, chance of pace, comes into him and he swivels around and pulls through square leg for one
very full outside off, dipping on him, drilled to mid-off
full and drifting on the pads and he has timed that so well. Effortless six over deep backward square leg. Picked up off the pads and clipped away. That just had exquisite timing written all over it
short ball, slower in pace, does not bounce as much and he pulls it out to deep square leg
legbreak, pitching on middle, comes forward and drops it into covers for a single that brings up his half-century
full toss, given too much air outside off, comes forward and drives it through extra cover
short and wide, cut away to sweeper cover
pitched up on leg, defended off the front foot to the right of the bowler
plays the angle as the ball slides down leg and it turns away sharply to take the outside edge and goes into the off side
short and wide, cuts off the backfoot to point who dives across and cuts it off
full and wide outside off, drives away from the body and inside-edges it. It hits him on the right of his upper back and hence misses the stumps

another full ball, tries to loft it over mid-off and there is a man in the deep and he picks him out. Not a greatly timed shot as he does get the desired elevation. It was slightly wide outside off, so he probably did not find the middle of the bat
fullish length outside off, defended
on a length outside off, knocked back to the bowler
no pace at all, on a length and outside off, all the batsman can do is knock it down the pitch

good length outside off, pushes it out to covers and they take off for a single. There is a direct hit at the striker's end but Ireland's fielders do not seem too excited. He drags the bat but Rashid has been caught short of his crease. This is an important strike. Rashid was well-set and could have powered them to a strong finish. Now, they have been hurt in that regard. Double-wicket maiden and what a time for that - 43rd over of the innings
too much air, full toss that is whipped away to deep midwicket
pitched up on leg, comes forward and blocks
short and spinning away outside off, tries to slap it away but picks out extra cover

flighted outside off and he shapes up for an extravagant drive but the ball dips on him and he cannot make contact. Keeper takes the bails off as his back foot slightly came up but he has planted it down in time
short and wide, cut to sweeper cover
short ball again, legbreak from Stirling and it is pulled mightily to deep midwicket
length outside off, stays in the crease and chops it into the ground as the ball goes away towards the cordon. Tries to cut but too full to do it
good length ball, coming in, swings big and misses
too full outside off, driven away from the body to covers where Porterfield dives to save a boundary
shout for lbw, not given. Full and coming in to him slightly. Plays the shot early as he tries to flick it away across the line, Seems pretty close, did the umpire think there was an inside edge?
width on offer outside off and it is worked out to point
full toss outside off, thumped straight down the ground as the ball crashes into the sightscreen
angling in on the pads, short of a length, turns it away to backward square leg but not off the middle of the bat
full toss, comes forward and gently pushes it to covers for one
full and on off, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
sliding on the pads, tries ti clip it away but the ball goes off the pads to deep fine leg
short of a length, tries to jump up and tuck it away but gets a leading edge to point
sprayed down the leg side. Tries to tuck away and the ball goes off the pad to the wicketkeeper who dives to his left to collect it on the bounce

good length outside off, opens the face of the bat to work it to point and takes off for a single. Non-striker was a tad late to get off the blocks and there is a direct hit at the keeper's end. Full-length dive put in by Shafiqullah. And that has probably saved him here. The bat has crossed the line as the bails are knocked off but the only question is if the bat is in the air. Does not seem so. He looks pretty okay and the green light flashes on

full and angling in on off, picks the length early and is waiting for it. Keeps the front leg out of the way and stays inside of the line to give himself of the room. He was shuffling across initially but sees the ball angling in and makes the late adjustment well to loft it over long-on
backing away again and the ball is fired full and it has been squeezed out to deep point for a brace
full and wide outside off, tries to fetch it from there and plays a sweep. The ball is cut off just before the deep midwicket boundary
full and coming in, again he has given himself the room he requires to launch it over deep midwicket. Slogged clean into the grassbanks
lucky boundary. Trying to fetch a pull from way outside off and gets an outside edge that flies over the wicketkeeper and into the third man boundary

run out chance, missed. Short of a length ball, Zadran knocks it straight back in the direction of the bowler and takes off for a run. He is rightly sent back and Chase bends forward, picks it up and has a shy but misses. He was pretty close to the stumps there but the batsman is safe
short ball, pulled away behind square for one
full and outside off, driven off the front foot to long-off
tries to cut this short ball but is cramped for room and the ball bounces more than he would have liked, misses it
jumps back to this length ball and drops it in front of point with an open bat face for one
another wide outside off, just how many of those he has bowled today. Intention is right, wants to choke the scoring by making the batsman reach out but he needs to be careful
low full toss, pushed down to long-off for one
full and wide outside off, outside the line
would have been another wide had the batsman not walked across early. He wanted to be able to reach out for it and shovels it with a flat bat to sweeper cover
yorker on off and middle, dug out to midwicket

yorker on leg, tries to dig it out and inside-edges it to the pad as the ball rolls into the off side. bowler runs across and slides in but fails to pick it up. But the basmen would have made it anyway, I think
flirting with the wide line outside off by bowling it full and it goes over the line there. Umpire seems to think it's fine

lofted over the covers region. Very full and outside off, moves across and plays it uppishly out to deep extra cover where Dockrell is a bit slow to get around it and that allows Shafiqullah to come back for the second
fuller, lofted away wide of long-off for one
legbreak on off, Shafiqullah gets down on one knee and slogs it over deep midwicket. Clean hit. What a knock he is playing here
goes for the slog again but this time it is the off-break and spins in to take the inside edge
full and wide outside off, swings hard and misses
eyeing the leg side boundary. Too full and drilled out uppishly wide of long-on. Shafiq wants the second but Dawlat does not even move. Fifty for Shafiq, off 28 balls
full and outside off, moves across and lets it go, hoping for a wide call but it not to be
off-break from Stirling. It is a full toss and he swings hard, bottom hand comes off as he slogs it high and clean over deep midwicket
good length ball at off stump, watched carefully and tapped into the off side off the front foot
shot! Back of a length in the corridor, sits up harmlessly on this slow pitch, he transfers the weight onto his back foot and slaps this on the bounce to the midwicket boundary
full ball at leg stump, grips in the pitch and gets the leading edge on the flick, into the off side all along the floor
loud appeal, but going down leg. Slight shape into the left hander, but it started on leg stump and hit him outside the line as he tried to glance it
good length ball, swinging in at off stump, driven on the up to mid-off
good length, outside off, opens the face to run it square, but can't get it past point
good length ball, tailing into the batsman, traps him on the pads, outside the line of leg stump
this swing is really troubling Joyce. This one is at a good length, but keeps much lower and thuds into the pad. Going down
good length ball, angled across off stump, driven on the up, away from the body, straight to cover
Joyce will be happy with this single. This one nips back in off the pitch and gets a thick inside edge down to fine leg as he pokes in front of his body
loud confident call of no after he waits for the outswing and drives this on the up to cover
shot. Goes full this time to try and find the edge, it swings away from Stirling but is full enough for him to stretch his arms and crash it through cover point
good length at middle stump, pushed to mid-on off the front foot
good length ball at middle stump, good stride in and defended to mid-off with the full face

what a poor sequence of cricket this is. Back of a length ball at middle stump, he swings across the line lazily, gets a top-edge that hangs up for extra cover who runs in and puts down a sitter. It was a no-ball, of course, so there's not a cricketer on this field right now who can say anything about it. Shafiq was the fielder who took it too easy. Had at least a few seconds to take it after getting under it, but his effort was lazy too. Clipped his fingertips and went to ground. Looked up and the umpire was there, signalling a no-ball
full ball at leg stump, clears the front foot and clatters this over mid-on off the middle of the bat
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man
full at off stump, driven to mid-off on the up
good length ball, wide outside off, left alone

this time Joyce is the only one who has made a mistake. Full ball, no movement, wide outside off. He chases at it with no feet and gets an outside edge that the keeper has made no mistake with...they're going upstairs to check the no-ball and it is fine
back of a length at off stump, closes the face and turns it into the leg side
good length at off stump, hardly any feet, pushed to mid-off late and on the up
another display of how slow the pitch is. Back of a length at middle stump, goes through with the pull too early and gets struck on the side
shot. Full blooded cover drive to this overpitched ball outside off, Shafiqullah dives low to his left to stop this time
yorker at middle stump, tails away slightly as he tries to push this to mid-on with an angled bat. Thick outside edge into the off side
full at middle stump, no movement this time and he taps it back to the bowler with more control
good length at off stump, defended off the front foot to point
short ball at off stump, he just has to get a short stride in and wait. The pitch offers it up nicely for his swing across the line and he hits it, one bounce to the midwicket boundary
slower ball at middle stump, inside half of the bat and it goes straight to midwicket
back of a length outside off, crunched on the up, straight to cover
back of a length at off stump, opens the face late to try and run it to third man, but Shenwari puts in a dive to his right at point to stop it
full ball at off stump, swinging in slightly as he gets a big stride and drives it to mid-off
good length at leg stump, swings in slightly, tapped to mid-on with soft hands
full ball at off stump, defended back to the bowler
good length ball, angled in at leg stump, nudged to fine leg

Rashid Khan holds on at slip and poses like one Mr. Afridi. Good length ball, angled across off stump, tries to cream this on the up through cover, gets a thick edge that flies straight to Rashid at waist height
back of a length at middle stump, exposes the stumps to make room as he defends off the back foot
good length ball comes in with the arm at off stump, gets the inside half of the bat as he defends
tossed up at middle stump, pushed to short midwicket
full ball at middle stump, pushed to cover off the front foot
good length outside off, pushed to cover off the front foot
good length ball at leg stump, grips and straightens as he tries to flick, leading edge back to the bowler along the pitch
glorious shot. Full ball outside off, leans into it, opens the face and squeezes it past cover point with full balance
full ball at off stump, short stride this time as he pushes it off the middle of the bat to covers
rash from O'Brien. Full and wide outside off, he keeps throwing this bait and they keep chasing it. This one slides through to the keeper though
back of a length at off stump, defended to mid-on off the back foot
back of a length outside off, defended straight to cover point off the back foot
good length ball at off stump, rolls his fingers on it, defended into the off side
good length at off stump, defended into the off side with soft hands
oh falls short of mid-on. Steps out at this full ball and punches it aerially towards Stanikzai. But it falls well in front of him, skids and deflects off his thigh
tossed up at middle stump, driven to long-on
good length at off stump, this time he's in control as he taps it to mid-on and takes his throw on succesfully
good length ball outside off stump, defended into the off side
tossed up at middle stump, flicked into the leg side where midwicket slides to his left but can't stop the run
good length at middle stump, defended back to the bowler
full at middle stump, driven inside-out to long off
good length at off stump, pushed to cover on the up
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler off the front foot

nearly gets him but that difficult chance will go down as a dropped catch. Good length ball at off stump, gets on one knee and goes for the slog sweep. It flies towards Shenwari at the mdiwicket boundary who times his jump nicely but just about tips it behind him
good length at middle stump, pushed past midwicket off the front foot
good length outside off, defended into the off side
good length ball, slides in with the arm, shoveled to long-on on the up
back of a length ball, spins in from outside off. He goes deep in his crease and turns it to backward point
full at off stump, driven to extra cover's right
good length at off stump, pushed to extra cover's left
good length ball outside off, spits and jumps to catch the flap of the pad as he goes forward to defence
back of a length outside off, spins back in sharply. He shapes to cut, lets it go as the room reduces
good length ball at middle stump, not to the pitch as he swipes across the line. Thick inside edge to long leg
good length at off stump, pushed into the off side
full at middle stump, steps out and pushes it to long-on
good length outside off, steps out, not to the pitch and offers his pad to save himself
tossed up at off stump, driven to sweeper cover
good length at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length outside off, steps out and offers the pad again
good length outside off, no feet movement this time, stays in the crease and slashes at it. straight to deep point
good length at off stump, steps out and defends, not to the pitch
not to the pitch again, pushed into the leg side off the inside half of the bat
good length at off stump, goes back and tries to whip it into the leg side, gets it off the toe of the bat, back to the bowler
good length ball at off stump, walks across the stump and pushes it to short fine
full at middle stump, steps out and pushes it to deep midwicket off his pads
full at off stump, leans in and pushes it out to sweeper cover
back of a length quicker ball outside off, stands tall and punches it to sweeper cover's right
good length ball flighted at off stump, defended back to the bowler
leading edge doesn't carry. Full ball at middle stump, closes the face too early as he tries to pick the midwicket gap, leading edge lands short of the bowler
steps out at the good length ball at middle, pushes it to long-on on the up
good length, angled in at off stump, goes down the track and pushes with the angle to long-on
tossed up outside off, bat turns as he tries to drive this through cover, back down the pitch to the bowler
full at middle stump, driven to long-on
arm ball, good length, aimed at middle, punched on the up to long-off
short and slightly outside off, goes back and chops it to short third man's left
good length outside off, driven on the up to sweeper cover
full outside off, driven hard to sweeper cover's right
dropped short at middle stump, hurries him as he goes back and pulls this wide of long-on

can't hold on to the throw and misses the run out! Short and wide outside, cuts it hard to sweeper's right. He picks up and throws it at the non-strikers, where the bowler hasn't gone behind the stumps. He's slightly to the side, and has to panic as he tries to catch and flick this, but he doesn't gather. The batsman wasn't in the frame for that run out
good length at middle stump, tapped into the leg side
good length at middle stump, hangs back and turns it to deep square leg
good length ball outside off, slashed to sweeper cover with no feet
good length ball, angled into the pads and thuds into it as he tries to flick this fine with the angle
goes around and bowls a short slower ball outside off, chops it into the pitch as he tries to cut away from the body
full ball outside off, leans into it, driven to sweeper cover
shot! Full at off stump, gets the front leg out of the way and crashes this past mid-off
good length at leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket
beautiful shot. Full ball at leg stump, offers the full face, elbow is high and the shape is perfect as he drives it to long-on to bring up fifty for the partnership
good length at off stump, turns slightly but he drives through the line to sweeper cover
full at off stump, opens up and pushes it wide of mid-off
short and wide outside off, hammers the cut shot but backward point dives to his right and parries it to sweeper cover to save three runs
dropped! Short and wide outside off, turns in slightly to cramp him on the cut, but the keeper has put it down
short and wide, goes for the cut, beaten
good length at off stump, leans in and pushes to long-off
good length ball angled in at the pads, pushed to midwicket
good length ball, angled down the leg side, tickled fine off the pad
good length outside off stump, leans in and pushes it to cover
good length ball outside off, tries to drive this through the off side, big gap between bat and pad, inside half of the bat and rolls back to the bowler
full at off stump, steps out and punches it past the non-striker. Long-on runs to his right and tumbles to cut it off
short and wide outside off, skids and climbs over the attempted cut
short at off stump, spins away slightly, not too much room but he connects the cut shot. Backward point tumbles to his right to stop
fabulous one-day batting. This one is spinning away from outside off, but he's walked across, got low on one knee and picked the vast open spaces of the fine leg boundary
good length at off stump, driven to long-off
full ball outside off, leans in and opens the face to push it to short third man
tossed up at off stump, driven firmly to long-off
good length ball at middle stump, hangs back and waits till it's right under his eyes to push it in front of short fine and steal a single
back of a length outside off, keeps low as he goes on the back foot and slices it to deep point
full ball outside off, puts in a stride and drives to sweeper cover to bring up his third consecutive half-century
full at middle stump, flicked to midwicket
back of a length at off stump, bites into the pitch and comes on slowly. Driven on the up, one-bounce to cover
this one sits in the pitch too. Good length at off stump, pushes at it and lobs it into the off side
good length at middle stump, steps out and pushes to long-on
back of a length at leg stump, defended off the back foot to midwicket

dropped! Good length ball at middle stump, steps out, he's not to the pitch and pushes it back in the air. Easy height, slow pace. But it's in line with the non-striker who stands his ground and the bowler collides with him with outstretched hands and puts it down
back of a length at off stump, chopped to short third man
good length ball outside off, opens the face and defends to short third man
good length ball, slides in with the angle, catches the inside edge as the bat and pad are close together on the forward defence. Loud appeal turned down
good ball first up. Good length outside off, spins and bounces sharply as he searches for it outside off with no feet
good length ball outside off, sliced to point
short and wide outside off, skids through quickly and beats the cut
tossed up outside off, puts in a stride and slaps this to sweeper cover
good length ball, pitches on leg, turns down the leg side and has possibly brushed the trousers on the way into the keeper's gloves
tossed up at off stump, goes for the big drive through the off side. Again, this is not the pitch for that shot. Big gap between bat and pad. Inside edge onto boot and into the leg side
walks across the stumps early and has to reach out to connect the sweep as this good length ball is fired down the leg side. Short fine puts in a dive to his right
good length at middle stump, uses the angle and drops it into the leg side
walks across the stumps again, this time the line is closer to him. Off and middle, good length. Smothers the bounce and hits on top of it to find the long leg boundary
flat ball, back of a length at off stump, goes deep in the crease and chops it to sweeper's right
dropped short at middle stump, hurries him on the pull, and he jams it out to long leg with no power
good length ball at off stump, defended into the off side
googly, good length outside off, picks it and defends into the leg side
short and wide outside off, spinning away, cuts it behind square and sweeper runs and has to dive to his right
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
oooo! Legspin bowling at it's most beautiful. Drifted in at off stump at a good length, spins away and past his outside edge as he goes to defend
good length at off stump, pushed into the off side
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
back of a length at off stump, goes deep and slaps this flat-batted over the bowler and past mid-off who is in the circle. Pure core strength.
back of a length at off stump, driven to sweeper off the back foot
good length ball, fired down the leg side
good length at the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
good length at the pads, nudged through square leg
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length at off stump, whipped to midwicket
back of a length at off stump, squeezed to cover off the back foot
good length ball, drifted in at off stump, spins away sharply as he lets it go without cover his off stump
and there it is. Tossed up outside off, thick inside edge as he tries to drive this through cover
googly, back of a length at middle stump, follows the turn and pushes it square into the off side off the back foot
back of a length googly at off stump, glanced to long leg
tossed up at off stump, driven straight to sweeper cover
tossed up at off stump, tries to flick this past midwicket but he puts in a dive to his right

got him! Back of a length outside off, he has offered that gap between bat and pad all along and one has finally snuck through. Plays for the angle and goes for the cut but this one spins back in and rams the off stump
full ball at leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket
dreadful ball. Short and down the leg side, great offering, slapped behind square on the leg side
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
good length at middle stump, defended into the off side
oooooo nearly lets one take his stumps. Good length ball just straightens to miss off stump after angling in. He lets it go.
back of a length at middle stump, turns it into the leg side off the back foot with the angle
back of a length at off stump, chopped to backward point
good length at off stump, steps out and drives it to long-off
back of a length outside off, keeps low as he stabs at it to push it into the off side
slider fired in at a good length outside off, lets it go
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
another slider, this one is angled in at leg stump and he just about pushes this to midwicket off the back foot
tossed up outside off, shapes to slam this to the cover boundary but gets it off the toe to long-off
short and wide outside off, slides under his attempted cut
tossed up at off stump, driven to sweeper
good length at middle stump, goes on the back foot and defends back to the bowler
back of a length, angled in at off stump, chopped to short third man
great shot. Tossed up at middle stump, gets low and middles the sweep to find that gap at long leg that Afghanistan insist on keeping
arm ball, angled in at off stump, no feet as he pokes into the off side
in the blockhole at middle stump, jammed back at the bowler
back of a length, angled in at off stump, hangs back and chops it to sweeper cover
full ball fired down the leg stump, gets low and goes for the sweep, but he can't connect and it thuds into his pads off the inside edge
short at off stump, turns away slightly as he goes for the pull. He isn't in control of it and it's aerial, but well wide  of long-on. Midwicket was inside
full ball outside off, driven expansively, straight to sweeper cover
back of a length at off stump, pushed to long-on off the back foot
good length outside off, thick outside edge to short third man as he tries to drive on the up
what a shot. Good length outside off, short stride forward and bludgeoned wide of long-off on the up. He has no business connecting it that hard, forget getting four for it, on this pitch
back of a length, angled in at middle stump, pushed nervously to midwicket with no feet
good length outside off, driven on the up to sweeper cover
good shot, straight to the fielder. Slight tail in at off stump at a length, but he's stood tall and middled the cover drive
full at off stump, tailing in again, he tries to use the movement to chip it wide of long-on, but he doesn't quite connect, it's straight at long on
full at middle stump, angled in from wide of the crease, flicked to midwicket
full at the pads, flicked to deep square leg
good length at off stump, pushed on the up to cover where the fielder misfields and parries it to long-off
full at off stump, driven to sweeper cover's right
full at middle stump, steps out and drives inside-out, slightly uppishly, to long-off
full at middle stump, gets low and finds deep square leg with the sweep
goes inside out again and chips this middle stump ball over the bowler after running down the track
back of a length, flat and fast outside off, outside edge rolls away quickly to the third man boundary
full at off stump, driven to sweeper cover
good length at off stump, opens the face and defends to point
good shot. Safe shot. Googly tossed up outside off stump, goes to the pitch and lifts it across the line to the midwicket boundary where there is no fielder.
good length at off stump, defended to cover with the turn
googly outside off, picks it and defends off the front foot
back of a length outside off, chopped to backward point
short of a length, tries to pull it away but misses
width on offer outside off, gets it away to deep backward point

full and wide outside off, slashes and the ball races away to the deep point boundary. Point dives and there is a diving save in front of the boundary. But it seems the body has brushed the ropes. Not while pushing it away, he has done a fine job of that. But the ball has rolled back and hit him after he touches the ropes
short ball, pulls and picks out square leg
fuller and on middle and off, comes forward and pushes it to extra cover. Fifty of the partnership between these two
fullish and just outside off, comes forward and taps it just wide of extra cover for a quick single
sliding on leg, tucked with the angle to midwicket. It is vacant there and there are three fielders converging on it. Stirling is slightly slow but they complete the second run
fullish ball, comes forward and pushes it into the off side
googly from Rashid, sliding on leg, tucked away through midwicket for a brace
angled in on off and spinning away, stands tall inside the crease and bunts it out
sliding on middle and leg and turning away, takes the outer part of the bat as the front foot defence goes into the off side
flat, on off, pushed into the off side
flighted outside off and driven through covers
flat and short of a length, turns it away with the spin to the backward square leg region
tossed up ball, turned away to midwicket

oh, he's gone. Stirling gone for 99. He cannot believe his luck and is crestfallen at the crease. He was dismissed for 95 in the previous game, a wrong decision from the umpire cost him. And this time he has been castled one short of a century. Wants to play for the spin but misses the line completely as the ball comes on straight with the arm and takes out his off stump
flighted outside off, defends off the front foot
sliding on leg, reverse swept through the gaps square of the wicket on the off side. Sweeper runs across and the ball beats him to the boundary
down the leg side, gets down to sweep and cannot put bat to ball
on a length and keeping low on middle, jams the bat down and whips it away through midwicket
spinning away outside off after pitching on off, defended hurriedly as he is rushed for pace
short of good length, it's the googly, enough time for the batsman to pick it and work it away towards mid-on
flighted outside off, comes forward and sticks his bat out and gets beaten
on a length, does not understand which way it will spin left alone in the channel outside off
too full to do anything, pushed off the front foot to mid-on
drifting on the pads, turned away to midwicket
full and drifting on the pads, it is a packed off side field and he has bowled on the pads. Worked to deep midwicket
advances down the track and turns it away behind square on the leg side
tossed up on the stumps, uses his wrists to turn it away to midwicket
breaks the shackles. Much-needed boundary. Pitched up outside off and the batsman strides forward and drives a tad uppishly through extra cover
flighted, advances down the ground, takes it on the full and nudges it away into the leg side
drops into the off side and looks for a single but decides against it
spinning away outside off, defended into the off side from the crease
gives it too much air outside off and it is driven to covers. Cannpt find the gap
short and wide, not spin and Shahzad was probably expecting it to turn away and the ball comes on straight instead. He misses and it runs away into the boundary

sharp turn. Shahzad fluffs a stumping chance. Draws the batsman by pitching it up and gets it to spin away. Shahzad takes the bails off but the ball is not in his hands. He has done it before collecting the ball
short ball, rocks back and cuts to backward point
played into the off side from the crease
comes forward and eases it down to long-on
reverse sweep from Balbirnie. Pitched up and sliding down leg, picks the vacant gaps square of the wicket
and this time he gets an outside edge to the third man region. The extra fielder had moved to the off side and the line of attack was going to be off stump. Fired full and the batsman ekes an edge
tucked behind square
angling in from a length on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
fullish and angling in, wants to pick the vacant spaces in midwicket but is late in closing the bat face and the ball goes to mid-on instead
through the in-field and gets it wide of sweeper cover. Full and wide, places it perfectly by moving away to give himself just enough room and places it wide of short extra cover
short and wide, sitting up nicely but not much pace on the ball, he had rolled his fingers over the seam, cut away to sweeper cover
very full ball, yorker, going down leg and raps him on the pad. Appeal for lbw but not given. There is no signal from the umpire, so that indicates an inside edge
fullish length outside off, opens the bat face late and gets it away to third man
fuller length and sliding on middle and leg, gets down and sweeps around to long leg
flighted outside off and tries to fetch a sweep from outside off. The ball is dying on him and he gets a top edge on the sweep as the ball goes behind the stumps, over the wicketkeeper
on a length, tucked off the pads to the midwicket region
comes on straight with the arm outside off so he gets cramped for room as he looks to slap this short ball away
pitched up and swept around to deep square leg. The fielder is just behind square and that allows him to come back for the second
some width on offer outside off, punched off the backfoot to deep point
full toss, driven to mid-on
full and on the pads, angling in, uses the inward angle to clip it behind square. Wants a second but it has gone pretty straight to the deep backward square leg fielder
very full, just outside off, extremely well-bowled, hint of reverse as well and all the batsman can do is dig it out off the inside portion of the bat back to the bowler
chance of a catch, not taken. Clipped uppishly to midwicket and Rashid Khan gets down to his left but cannot get his hands under the ball. It escapes from beneath his hands into the deep
makes room for himself and the bowler has dragged his length back here. He tries to flay it through the off side but chops it hard into the turf.
tries to fetch a sweep from way outside off and gets nowhere near it. Misses
again swept from outside off. Moves across as it is fired outside off and the ball is hit out to deep midwicket

pitched up outside off, not much pace on the surface which means clearing the in-field is always hard. Chips a drive but he has picked the gap well, clearing the short extra cover fielder and beats long-off running to his left and diving
pushed through quicker outside off, hurries him for pace and gets him beaten
oh, he has picked the gap beautifully here. It is full on middle and he has got the front leg across. Sweeps wide of the deep backward square leg fielder, gets it a lot finer of the man there
pushed through quicker outside off, defended
fullish and on middle and leg, tries to drill it through the off side and squirts it off the inside part of the bat to midwicket for one
advances down the track and the bowler drags the length back, he is forced to respond with a pull shot that is dragged towards mid-on
what a shot! Picks the length very early. Backs away and stays leg side of it. It is full and he has given himself enough room before neatly lofting it over the extra cover and mid-off region
short of a length outside off, rolls his fingers over the seam and the batsman chops the cut to covers
full and wide, holding its line, slashes away from the body, he had to get near it and ends up getting beaten

full and on the stumps, he is backing away and whips it with the inward angle to deep midwicket. It was the off-cutter and he picked it early, fielder at deep midwicket dives but makes contact with the ball while he is touching the ropes
sliding on middle and leg and spinning away, tries a sweep across the line and gets beaten
flat and pitched up outside off, pushed off the front foot to sweeper cover for one. Singles will do it for Ireland
tries to cut but there is really not enough room, gets an inside edge towards the keeper. Could have chopped on
and again he slaps off the backfoot but this time there is more room and he gets it off the middle of the bat before sweeper tidies up
swept away and not a clean stop at the deep midwicket boundary. The fielder dives but he has not got his hands on the ball which goes from beneath him and into the boundary
flat and outside off, opens the face of his bat to short third man
on the blockhole on leg, dug out to the off side and the bowler picks it up on the follow-through
goes for the yorker again but bowls a full toss on the stumps, driven on the up and the ball drops just short of the fielder diving to his front at covers

and that's the game for Ireland. Full and on the fifth-stump channel and that does it for Ireland. Drilled through covers and he has placed that so well. Wide of the sweeper cover fielder and into the deep extra cover boundary
